intro: Tribulus inermis, commonly known as goat's horn, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Zygophyllaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, spiral-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Tribulus inermis thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its unique morphology and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitats.
